channel.title: DynamoDB on Cloudant blog
channel.description: Recent content in DynamoDB on Cloudant blog

item.title: Moving data from DynamoDB
item.description: If you have data in an Amazon DynamoDB service and want to move it to IBM Cloudant or Apache CouchDB, how would you go about it? First of all, DynamoDB has a peculiar form of JSON. A single temperature measurement would be expressed like this: { "temperature": { "N": "8391" }, "time": { "S": "2017-03-09T01:38:11+0000" }, "id": { "S": "1489023491" } } Instead of the more straightforward JSON: { "temperature": 8391, "time": "2017-03-09T01:38:11+0000", "id": "1489023491" } Cloudant and CouchDB can store any JSON documents with nested objects of arbitrary complexity, whereas DynamoDB stores a series of key values at the top of the JSON tree.
